Function.Description: The floor function returns the largest Integer less than or equal to the numeric argument.

Brief.Overview: The floor function returns the largest Integer less than or equal to the numeric argument.
Brief.Usage: The floor function is a type of rounding function that always rounds DOWN to the nearest Integer. The number returned by the ceiling function will be less than or equal to the Number argument. (See the ceiling function for rounding up or the round function for normal rounding .)

Syntax.Return: The largest Integer that is less than or equal to the argument.
